Body:
A late answer but perhaps it will help someone. Here's some code to generate a rule very similar to that of the example.

\documentclass[11pt]{article}
\usepackage{amsmath,amsthm,amssymb}

\usepackage{tipa}
\usepackage{soul}

\begin{document}


\begin{math}
\left[
\begin{array}{l}
+\mbox{stop} \\
+\mbox{consonant} \\
+\mbox{alveolar}
\end{array}
\right]
\longrightarrow 
\end{math} % Ending math mode to use the IPA symbol below 
[\textfishhookr] % Using `tipa' package in the preamble
\begin{math} % Resume math mode
\left. \middle/ 
\left[
\begin{array}{l}
+\mbox{vowel} \\
+\mbox{stressed}
\end{array}
\right]
\right.
\end{math} % Ending math mode to have a good underscore below (using package `soul')
\setul{.5cm}{.4pt}% Lower the space between the underline and the text
\ul{$\qquad$} 
\begin{math}
\left[
\begin{array}{l}
+\mbox{vowel} \\
-\mbox{stressed}
\end{array}
\right]
\end{math}


\end{document}

And it should look like this:

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I am a linguistics student interested in semantics. I also keep track of some discussions about syntax, pragmatics, philosophy of language and philosophy of mind. Someday, I hope to teach what I am learning now. It's all about sharing knowledge!
